== Who I Am ==
My name is Bartlomiej Zolnierkiewicz, and I'm member of the Ubuntu Kernel Team. I help maintain a variety of Ubuntu kernels and related packages in accordance with our <nowiki>[[StableReleaseUpdates|Stable Release Updates Cycle]]</nowiki>. I mainly contribute to Ubuntu Bluefield Linux Kernels.

== My Ubuntu Story ==
After many years of using different Linux distributions (mainly Fedora, Scientific Linux and OpenSUSE) I've started using Ubuntu in 2012. In my new job Ubuntu was the preferred distribution to use on the workstation (it was used by the most people from my team). It surprised me how things "just work" in Ubuntu without investing a lot of time into its maintenance. Ubuntu became my favorite distribution. Since 2012 I've worked 9 years developing kernels for embedded boards, mobiles and watches for use in the Tizen distribution. In 2021 I've finally decided that it is time to move on and I've joined the Canonical's Linux Kernel Team.

=== My Involvement ===
I've worked in a variety of areas including: kernel support for IBM hardware, packaging MOFED drivers for nVidia/Mellanox Bluefield devices, CVE triaging & back-porting, mailing list review and general kernel package preparation.

=== Upload Rights ===
I'm requesting upload rights for the kernel package set for all active series, which includes all the "linux*" packages.

== Comments ==
''If you'd like to comment, but are not the applicant or a sponsor, do it here. Don't forget to sign with `@``SIG``@`.''

== Endorsements ==

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA512

=== Kleber Souza (kleber-souza) ===

==== General feedback ====

I have been working with Bartlomiej at different levels since he joined the Kernel Team. I have sponsored some of the linux-ibm kernels initially and lately we have been working closer on the linux-bluefield kernels maintenance and bring up. Bart has an extensive technical background, is very attentive to details and never compromises on quality. Bart always works quickly on the feedback given and is always willing to learn.

I trust on Bart to continue producing kernel packages with quality, following the Kernel SRU process and asking questions when not sure about something.

==== Specific Experiences of working together ====

Apart from working on the kernel packages, Bart has also made great contributions to the solution for building MOFED packages for the linux-blufield kernel.

==== Areas of Improvement ====

The only area of improvement I would suggest for Bart is that he can be more proactive sometimes and poke people to get things done to unblock his work.

I have reviewed and uploaded a number of private kernels for

very careful when preparing kernels and he is able to deal with more
complicated scenarios as well, including re-spin of past cycles where
one needs to be very careful about the correct base version, the
intended version number and a bunch of other factors.

Bartlomiej also knows very well how to deal with scenarios that might
be ambiguous, always looking for help and guidance before making a
decision that could cause us some kind of re-work. Because of that he
has my endorsement.

=== Luke Nowakowski-Krijger ===

==== General feedback ====
I have reviewed a lot of Bartlomiej's work and all of his uploads and packages have been prepared well and with care. Anytime I've ever had to poke him to fix something he always is quick to resolve issues and almost never repeats them. Almost everything I've seen from him for the last good amount of time, even in the more complicated scenarios that need special preperations, has been well prepared and without issue. For that I completely trust him with upload rights and give him my endorsment and +1.

Already mentioned but don't be afraid to poke people to get stuff moving.
